Articles.Content:
Fantastic mod!

One question, though; does the shape and size of the wing influence the lift produced, or is it simply the number of wing segments that matter?

I mean this that is showing on the pics, the movable part seams to be part of the wing, not and extra part extension.

Those would be flight control surfaces, yes.

This is what Wikipedia redirects to when you search for "winglet" .

Of course, I was off too with my "flight surfaces".

Is there any way to check the Lift value for a generated wing while still in the Hanger?

By the way, dang good work!
Due to overzealous optimization debugging only works in flight, will fix that.

Those would be flight control surfaces, yes.

This is what Wikipedia redirects to when you search for "winglet" .

Of course, I was off too with my "flight surfaces".

I told you the name winglet, and you don't understand, so, i show you the pics...

You don't need to repeat me, what you don't understand!
DYJ you have done it again, excellent work on this cant wait to see what else can be proceduraly done

I told you the name winglet, and you don't understand, so, i show you the pics...

You don't need to repeat me, what you don't understand!

I'm sure this is just a matter of language barrier.

Calm down.

I understand what you mean.

You mean the flight control surfaces. The rudders, elevators and the likes. The moving bits.

They are not winglets. Winglets are wing-like parts, either on the wingtips or connecting landinggear or other parts of the aircraft, like in the link I showed you.

Now lets go back to enjoying this amazing mod.

I'm sure this is just a matter of language barrier.

Calm down.

I understand what you mean.

You mean the flight control surfaces. The rudders, elevators and the likes. The moving bits.

They are not winglets. Winglets are wing-like parts, either on the wingtips or connecting landinggear or other parts of the aircraft, like in the link I showed you.

Now lets go back to enjoying this amazing mod.

Well, in the game, i saw a lot of people directing to the control surfaces, rudders, or "flaps", by winglets. But as by your Wiki link, that o see know, not before, it is only the extreme parts of wings, pointed up.

Lol

I 'm not install it yet...

Soon...
Beyond frickin' cool! Giving it a shot now

Just tried it and it was really cool and interesting.

The model of the wing looks fantastic and keep up the Great work!
Just a quick bug report that you may already know: the wings were not visible from within the cockpit. If that's already known, sorry, I must've missed it. Cool mod!
As soon as I repaired my PC, I will check it out Looks good though!

It seems that (at least with FAR) wing lift is a bit low. Replacing working planes' wings with these ones set to the same size result in a rocket powered rock.

On the topic of rocks, these wings also have a very high impact tolerance.

Edit: stupid me didn't read the rest of the forum. I excitedly await FAR support.

Edited May 21, 2013 by Ultraturbopanda
With FAR, those wings will still use stock flight model, so they won't work correctly. They'll lift stuff, but won't have FAR features working.
How about some procedural contol surfaces as well to complete the pack?
This is AWESOME thank you. looking forward to more things like this

Amazing mod!

It's fairly easy to use and works just like it is part of the stock game, no matter what size!

I've made forward swept wings and even improved my original aircraft, wich had lots of separated pieces of wing to for a single one.

EDIT: Only needs one thing, control surfaces to match the flexible size

Edited May 22, 2013 by cesarcurado

Amazing mod!

It's fairly easy to use and works just like it is part of the stock game, no matter what size!

I've made forward swept wings and even improved my original aircraft, wich had lots of separated pieces of wing to for a single one.

EDIT: Only needs one thing, control surfaces to match the flexible size

That's planned, and DYJ did get a totally broken one to not-work in game, but there's still a couple of gnarly bugs to fix in the main module before we start poking that.

Hey it wasn't all broken!

It definitely needs more work though, but it's coming.
I'm afraid I don't get it.. Can someone post an explanation video or something?

Very good mod thanks!

I'm afraid I don't get it.. Can someone post an explanation video or something?

Basically it is a wing that you can shape to your liking in the editor. Useful for creating that "cool looking wing" that your craft needs.
What is "Sort of" FAR support?

What is "Sort of" FAR support?

From the OP:

"(sort of)" ? FAR support is not really working since FAR doesn't seem to be picking up changes dynamically.
So you have to reload the craft to get FAR to pick up changes or somethig?
No, it will only ever see the default values for the wing, until ferram4 gets back to us with how to make FAR pick the changes up. That will be a few days, he has to fix FAR for 0.20 first
